questions.q: What does the <form> tag do in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <form> tag creates an interactive form that can collect user input through various input elements and submit that data to a server.
options: Creates a form for user input

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a text input field in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <input type="text"> creates a single-line text input field where users can enter text data.

questions.q: What is the purpose of the <meta> tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <meta> tag provides metadata such as character encoding, page description, keywords, author, and viewport settings for responsive design.
options: To define the structure of the document
To provide metadata about the document

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a hyperlink that opens in a new tab?
questions.explanation: Adding target="_blank" to an anchor tag makes the link open in a new browser tab or window.

questions.q: What does the <marquee> tag do in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <marquee> tag creates scrolling or sliding text. However, it's deprecated and should not be used; CSS animations are the modern alternative.

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a dropdown list in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <select> tag creates a dropdown menu. The <option> tags nested inside define the selectable items.

questions.q: What is the purpose of the <iframe> tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <iframe> tag embeds another HTML document within the current page, commonly used for embedding videos, maps, or other external content.
options: To embed another HTML document within the current document

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a button in HTML?
questions.explanation: Both <button> and <input type="button"> create clickable buttons. The <button> tag offers more flexibility with content.

questions.q: What does the <abbr> tag do in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <abbr> tag marks abbreviations or acronyms. The title attribute can provide the full form, shown as a tooltip on hover.

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a numbered list in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <ol> (ordered list) tag creates a numbered list with automatically generated numbers for each <li> (list item).

questions.q: What is the purpose of the <caption> tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <caption> tag provides a title or caption for a table, appearing above the table by default and describing its content.

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a hyperlink in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <a> (anchor) tag creates hyperlinks. The href attribute specifies the destination URL or page location.

questions.q: The <table> tag is used to create a table in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <table> tag is the main container for creating tables, which contain rows and cells for organizing data.

questions.q: The <form> tag is used to create a table in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <form> tag creates forms for user input, not tables. The <table> tag is used to create tables.

questions.q: The align attribute is used to specify the alignment of text in a table cell.
questions.explanation: True. The 'align' attribute controls horizontal alignment in table cells, though CSS text-align is now preferred.

questions.q: The <select> tag is used to create a dropdown list in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <select> tag creates a dropdown menu with selectable options defined by <option> tags.

questions.q: The <textarea> tag creates a single-line text input field in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <textarea> tag creates a multi-line text input field. Single-line inputs use <input type='text'>.

questions.q: The <tr> tag is used to define a table row in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <tr> tag defines a row in a table, which contains individual cells (<td>) or header cells (<th>).

questions.q: The <th> tag is used to define a table cell in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <th> tag defines a header cell, which is typically bold and centered. Regular table cells use the <td> tag.

questions.q: The width attribute is used to specify the width of a table in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The 'width' attribute sets table width in pixels or percentage, though CSS is now the preferred method.

questions.q: The <form> tag is used to create a form for user input in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <form> tag creates an interactive form that can contain various input elements like text fields, buttons, and checkboxes.

questions.q: The <input type="text"> tag is used to create a text input field in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <input type="text"> creates a single-line text input field for user data entry.
